verses.roman:
mayedaṁ bhagavan goṣṭha-
nāśāyāsāra-vāyubhiḥ
ceṣṭitaṁ vihate yajñe
māninā tīvra-manyunā

synonyms: mayā—by me; idam—this; bhagavan—O Lord; goṣṭha—of Your cowherd community; nāśāya—for the destruction; āsāra—by hard rain; vāyubhiḥ—and wind; ceṣṭitam—enacted; vihate—when it was disrupted; yajñe—my sacrifice; māninā—(by me) who was falsely proud; tīvra—fierce; manyunā—whose anger.
translation: My dear Lord, when my sacrifice was disrupted I became fiercely angry because of false pride. Thus I tried to destroy Your cowherd community with severe rain and wind.
